meanings.definition: A glycoprotein that helps cells attach to the extracellular matrix.
meanings.sent1: The fibronectin in our body plays a crucial role in cell attachment.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study fibronectin to understand how cells stick to surfaces.
meanings.sent3: The fibronectin molecule decided to throw a party and invite all the cells to attach.
meanings.sent4: Like a glue, fibronectin binds cells to the extracellular matrix.
meanings.sent5: The fibronectin protein acts as a bridge connecting cells to their surroundings.

meanings.definition: A protein involved in cell adhesion and migration.
meanings.sent1: Cells rely on fibronectin for sticking together and moving around.
meanings.sent2: Fibronectin helps cells stay connected and travel to different parts of the body.
meanings.sent3: The fibronectin protein decided to take a road trip with the cells for some adventure.
meanings.sent4: In the dance of cell movement, fibronectin leads the way like a guiding star.
meanings.sent5: The role of fibronectin in cell migration is like a navigator guiding a ship through rough seas.
